measured_by: continuous-outcome source memory location-recall task (word on circle, later reproduce angle)
justification: “In the present study, participants are shown words positioned continuously around the perimeter of a circle, and then later asked to reproduce the location of the cued word. The advantage of using such a task is that it allows direct measurement of response precision.”
“In these tasks, participants are asked to reproduce the color or orientation of studied items by selecting corresponding points on a color wheel or response circle.”

measured_by: confidence rating scale yielding ROC curves
justification: “Research … has been largely based on rating-scale data from two-choice tasks and used confidence ratings to construct Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curves.”

measured_by: two-choice item recognition task (old vs new word)
justification: “In contrast to recognition tasks, where the focus is on the presence or absence of an item in the study episode … participants are shown a shuffled list of 10 previously studied items and 10 foils and asked to rate each item on a six-point Old/New confidence scale.”
